text: The Korea Herald () is an English-language daily newspaper started in 1953, in Seoul, South Korea. It is one of the three big English-language daily newspapers in South Korea, along with and Korea JoongAng Daily. The employees are Korean and international writers and editors. They also publish news from the Associated Press. The Korea Herald is a member of the . == History == The Korea Herald started on August 1953, as The Korean Republic, a 4-page tabloid English-language daily. In August 1965, The Korean Republic was renamed The Korea Herald. In April 1982, the daily international edition of The Korea Herald was an 8-page tabloid. In September 1995, the newspaper started its website. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1950s establishments in South Korea Category:1953 establishments in Asia Category:English-language newspapers published in Asia Category:News websites Category:Newspapers published in South Korea
title: The Korea Herald
